Here we only list the Engine, not specific models1

This is an inline math equation: \(x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}\).

The area of a circle with radius (r) is given by the formula:

\[ [A = \pi r^2] \]

Where:

  • (A) is the area of the circle.

  • (pi) is approximately 3.14159.

  • (r) is the radius of the circle.

graph LR;
  A[A4, A5] --> B(S4, S5);
  B --> C(RS4, RS5);

This approach enables you to use the same bibliography with different citation styles without having to change anything about your document or the bibliography itself apart from the bibliography style when your paper is finally compiled for print. (Fenn 2006)

References

Fenn, Jürgen. 2006. “Managing Citations and Your Bibliography with BibTEX.” The PracTEX Journal. http://svn.tug.org/pracjourn/2006-4/fenn/fenn.pdf.
